description.narrative: The Strengthening Health Systems for Health Security - Multi Country Partnerships Program aims to strengthen health security systems to enable improved prevention, detection and response to communicable disease outbreaks. The investment delivers on the Indo-Pacific Health Security Initiative's investment pillar "catalysing international responses to countries' identified needs". The expected outcome is to increase compliance to norms established by the World Health Organization (International Health Regulations) and World Organisation for Animal Health (Performance of Veterinary Services). This will contribute to helping safeguard Australian interests and those of countries in our region by decreasing health security risks, and contributing to strengthened health systems to prevent and contain outbreaks of emerging or re-emerging infectious diseases with epidemic potential.
